critique: The executive order seems to aim to convey a sense of vigilance and seriousness regarding national security and economic stability. It invokes legal and historical context to emphasize the importance of export controls. The order does not explicitly aim to evoke joy. However, it may aim to reduce fear and anxiety by ensuring national security. It may aim to reduce disgust and sadness by protecting the domestic economy. It may aim to convey surprise by the extension of the Export Administration Act of 1969.
